Espresso Drupal Theme Documentation

Responsive Drupal Theme

  • Last Updated: May 25, 2014
  • Themed By: DesignsSquare.com
  • Email: contact@designssquare.com
.

Thank you for purchasing our theme. If you have any questions, please feel free to email us!

About

Whats included?

There are two items - modules and themes. The modules contain module - theme_Espresso to provide functionality and the module - designssquare_lib is shared library that is utilized by themes and modules. The themes contain theme - Bootstrap for providing the Twitter Bootstrap functionality that the Espresso theme utilizes. The theme - Espresso contains the actual drupal theme

Content Types or Layouts

  • Basic Page: this is standard page layout of the theme with two custom fields Title and Page Intro.
  • Basic Page - 3 Columns: this is standard page with layout of three columns each has its separate input field
  • Home: this is home or front page layout of the theme with regions - Row One, Row Two, Row Three
  • Contact the contact page layout with contact form included
  • Portfolio the portfolio page layout that is one without any columns
  • Project the project page layout that is one without any columns

Custom Fields

  • Column One, Two, Three:(field_column_xxx) The content input fields for each column in the layout - Basic Page - 3 Columns

Custom Regions

  • Region One, Two, Three:Regions displayed in the layout - Home in the order listed
  • Footer NavigationThe footer is devided into two regions - Footer and Footer Navigation. The region - Footer is on the left side of the footer. The region - Footer Navigation is on the Right Side fo the footer area

Installation

How To Install?

In the following are the steps to install Espresso theme

  1. Copy everything from modules directory into sites/all/modules directory
  2. Copy everything from themes directory into sites/all/themes directory
  3. Enable theme 'bootstrap' and enable/set 'espresso' theme as default
  4. Enable module 'DesignsSquare.com Espresso Theme' that will also enable module 'designssquare_com_theme_espresso_structure' and
  5. Enable module designssquare_com_theme_Espresso_data if you wish sample data. (Dependencies UUID and UUID_FEATURE module has to be of 7.x-1.0-alpha3+15-dev and above)
  6. Enable module designssquare_com_main_menu_importer to import main menu
  7. Enable module designssquare_com_bottom_menu_importer to import bottom menu
  8. Revert features designssquare_com_theme_Espresso_structure and designssquare_com_theme_Espresso_data(if sample data imported)
  9. clear all cache

Blocks

Espresso Theme comes with the following blocks

Name Delta Template Description
DesignsSquare Theme: Block: About ds_about blocks/block--ds-about.tpl.php The block was build to provide little intro about company/individual and is placed in region 'Row Three' in Home page(content type - Home) by default
DesignsSquare Theme: Block: About - Sidebar ds_about_sidebar blocks/block--ds-about-sidebar.tpl.php The same as the "DesignsSquare Theme: Block: About" just build for sidebar instead of the content region
DesignsSquare Theme: Block: Copy Rights ds_copy_rights blocks/block--ds-copy-rights.tpl.php The block was build for Copy Rights statement in the Footer Region
DesignsSquare Theme: Block: Announcement ds_announcement blocks/block--ds-announcement.tpl.php The block was build for announcements is placed in 'Row One' in Home page by default
DesignsSquare Theme: Block: Portfolio ds_portfolio blocks/block--ds-portfolio.tpl.php The block was build for displaying Portfolio and is placed in 'Row Two' in Home page by default
DesignsSquare Theme: Block: Portfolio - Sidebar ds_portfolio_sidebar blocks/block--ds-portfolio-sidebar.tpl.php The minimized version of "DesignsSquare Theme: Block: Portfolio" build for sidebar area
DesignsSquare Theme: Block: Recent Tweets ds_recent_tweets blocks/block--ds-recent-tweets.tpl.php The block for displaying latest tweets
DesignsSquare Theme: Block: Recent Posts ds_blog_recent_posts blocks/block--ds-recent-posts.tpl.php The block was build to display latest Post in Blog and is placed in "Row Three" region in home page by default
DesignsSquare Theme: Block: Recent Posts - Sidebar ds_blog_recent_posts_sidebar blocks/block--ds-recent-posts-sidebar.tpl.php the block build for sidebar area displaying last 3-5 posts from the Blog
DesignsSquare Theme: Block: Blog Categories ds_blog_categories blocks/block--ds-blog-categories.tpl.php the block build for sidebar area displaying categories of a Blog
DesignsSquare Theme: Block: Blog Archive ds_blog_archive blocks/block--ds-blog-archive.tpl.php the block build for sidebar area displaying archive of a Blog
DesignsSquare Theme: Block: Social ds_social blocks/block--ds-social.tpl.php the block build for sidebar area referncing links to social networks

*The blocks are available to edit in template files in BASIC package. To edit blocks from UI, please, upgrade to package - PLUS

Menus

There are two navigation menus - Main Menu and Bottom Menu. The main menu is assigned to the region 'navigation' region located on top of the page. The Bottom menu is assigned to region of 'Footer Navigation' part of the footer area of the page

Custom Theme Settings

Webmaster is is able to configure the theme background image from Theme Settings User Interface(i.e. admin/appearance/settings/espresso). There are total of 12 predefined backgrounds available to select the background. You are also able to upload your custom background image. The background image can be any image of type jpg, gif, png

The theme setting is configurable at Appearance -> Settings -> Espresso(admin/appearance/settings/espresso)

Other

Contact Form

There is contact form embeded in the content of structure type - Contact. The contact form are using the Drupal core module - Contact. Once enabled, ensure you configure your own Admin recipient at "admin/structure/contact"

Drupal Module Dependencies

In the following are direct dependencies for the Espresso theme:
  • pathauto: This module required for menu importer.
  • strongarm, features, uuid_features, features_extra all of these modules used for importing structure as well as the sample data. Important to note, that modules uuid and uuid_feature has to dev version of 7.x-1.0-alpha3+15-d or higher
  • jquery_update:1.8ver
  • Contact The core module - Contact for contact form functionality

Troubleshooting

1. Page Not Styled

Make sure the text format for the page is in full html or a format that does not remove or filter html tags and its attributes

PDOException: SQLSTATE[42S02]: Base table or view not found: 1146 Table 'test_espresso_db.contact' doesn't exist:

Ensure Contact module from Drupal Core is enabled
